vague_description: A coffee shop needs to figure out how many mochas and regular coffees to produce given limited resources and time constraints.
detailed_description: A coffee shop sells mochas and regular coffees. Each mocha requires \param{CoffeePowderPerMocha} units of coffee powder and \param{MilkPerMocha} units of milk. Each regular coffee requires \param{CoffeePowderPerRegular} units of coffee powder and \param{MilkPerRegular} units of milk. The shop has available \param{TotalCoffeePowder} units of coffee powder and \param{TotalMilk} units of milk. Making a mocha takes \param{TimePerMocha} minutes and making a regular coffee takes \param{TimePerRegular} minutes. Since mochas are more popular among people, the shop must make at least \param{MochaToRegularRatio} times as many mochas as regular coffees. How many of each should they make to minimize the total production time?
target_objective: Minimize the total production time for mochas and regular coffees
target_constraints: Number of regular coffees is non-negative
Total uses of coffee powder does not exceed TotalCoffeePowder
Total uses of milk does not exceed TotalMilk
The number of mochas made is at least MochaToRegularRatio times the number of regular coffees
target_parameters: Units of coffee powder required to make one mocha
Units of milk required to make one mocha
Units of coffee powder required to make one regular coffee
Units of milk required to make one regular coffee
Total available units of coffee powder
Time required to make one mocha
Time required to make one regular coffee
Minimum ratio of the number of mochas to the number of regular coffees
